meanings.sent1: She is the wisest student in the class.
meanings.sent2: The owl is known as one of the wisest birds.
meanings.sent3: Even the youngest child can sometimes be the wisest in the room.
meanings.sent4: In the land of the blind, the one-eyed man is the wisest.
meanings.sent5: His wrinkled face and kind eyes made him look like the wisest person in the village.

meanings.definition: Having or showing experience, knowledge, and good judgment.
meanings.sent1: The wisest decision is often the hardest one to make.
meanings.sent2: Grandma is the wisest person I know; she always knows what to do.
meanings.sent3: The cat looked at the fishbowl with the wisest expression, as if planning a clever scheme.
meanings.sent4: The old tree in the forest stood tall and wise, its branches reaching out like the wisest of elders.
meanings.sent5: The ancient book contained the wisest teachings of the wise sage, passed down through generations.
